channel.title: Port Forwarding - Connection Refused?
channel.description:
Hey. Not sure if I can post this here. If I can't then please let me know. Anyway, I am trying to port forward. I am logged into my router, and on the website I went to Port Forward. I set the External and Internal starting and ending ports at 43594. It says that is correct. So I go to canyouseeme, and they said they couldn't see my port. So I run my server, and retry it, and it still says my port isnt open. Any help please? I believe I followed the tutorial correct, but I still cant figure this out. Thanks.
Can You See Me: Error: I could not see your service on (my IP) on port (43594) Reason: Connection refused

item.title: Port Forwarding - Connection Refused?
item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

[quote=“MyNameIsDylan, post:2, topic:543551”]Have you checked to make sure that the server’s source port is 43594 as well? It’s common for it to be 5555, or 43595 as well! To do so, just go to server.java, search for:

and change the number to your port number. Then you’ll need to go into the Configuration settings (the file symbol is a notepad and gear) server file, and change the port number in there too. Best of luck.[/quote]

Yes, I’ve made sure my port in my server is 43594. Now instead of Connection Refused, I am getting Connection Timed Out. :s is that worse?

Firewall. Your firewall is blocking it. Whether it is your windows firewall, antivirus, or router firewall, the connection is being denied.

I’ve allowed it through my Windows Firewall. I’ll check the others.

EDIT: I just disabled my firewalls to test it, and it still said Connection Timed Out.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding - Connection Refused?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Firewall. Your firewall is blocking it.
Whether it is your windows firewall, antivirus, or router firewall, the connection is being denied.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding - Connection Refused?
item.dc:creator: @MyNameIsDylan MyNameIsDylan
item.description:
@MyNameIsDylan wrote:

Have you checked to make sure that the server’s source port is 43594 as well? It’s common for it to be 5555, or 43595 as well! To do so, just go to server.java, search for:

and change the number to your port number. Then you’ll need to go into the Configuration settings (the file symbol is a notepad and gear) server file, and change the port number in there too. Best of luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding - Connection Refused?
item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

Hey. Not sure if I can post this here. If I can’t then please let me know. Anyway, I am trying to port forward. I am logged into my router, and on the website I went to Port Forward. I set the External and Internal starting and ending ports at 43594. It says that is correct. So I go to canyouseeme, and they said they couldn’t see my port. So I run my server, and retry it, and it still says my port isnt open. Any help please? I believe I followed the tutorial correct, but I still cant figure this out. Thanks.

Can You See Me:
Error: I could not see your service on (my IP) on port (43594)
Reason: Connection refused
